name: places/ChIJdeYU4g72wokRw1s3QeNGx_o
formattedAddress: 1820 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10035, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1820 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10035, USA

originalText.text: Super friendly professional staff. Makes you feel loved and cared for. I have had 4 sessions with them and will return for all my MRI needs.

text.text: Super friendly professional staff. Makes you feel loved and cared for. I have had 4 sessions with them and will return for all my MRI needs.

originalText.text: AVOID AT ALL COSTS. To start, my unilateral breast ultrasound (a procedure that should take about half an hour) was done by a young male technician who took more than TWO HOURS. When I asked why something relatively straight forward was taking so long, his response to me was repeating, "Don't worry." Very questionable, and I will be looking into this further. Second, it's been a month and a half, and my referring doctor has STILL not received the ultrasound results. I've called the center twice only to be informed that they do not have a scanner or a fax machine, for which the results cannot be faxed or emailed, and they're not sure when they'll be able to buy a fax machine. Their solution? I have to travel over an hour to physically pick up my results, and then another hour and half to the opposite end of the city to hand deliver to my doctor. What radiology center doesn't have the capability to, at the very least, email?! This is a horrible, horrible operation. If there is anything negative in my results, you can bet I will be suing for malpractice after what will be a two-month delay in receiving them.

originalText.text:
I should have read the reviews before I went here. I went because it's conveniently located and I got the ultrasound I needed but the follow up recommendation was to come back for an MRI. I called to set up an MRI only to find out that they don't do it there anymore and the male receptionist wanted to get rid of me and actually said,  "what's your birthday so we can end this call." Then I asked where should I go for the recumbent MRI, he said to ask Dr. Kimball. When I asked, "who's doctor Kimball," the receptionist let out a sigh and put me on hold and never came back. WORST MEDICAL SERVICE.

DO NOT GO HERE!

originalText.text: I had an appointment with this facility on Jan. 7th, 2019, nice, big, spacious area. Receptionist didn't seem like she really wanted to be there. It was a good crowd of people when I walked in.  I chose the seating behind the desk which was plentiful and less people. I didn't have to wait long for my MRI of the lower back spine and pelvis area. I was told it's only a 10 minute x-ray. My preparation was a squeeze ball and was told when I can't take anymore just squeeze the ball and the x-ray will stop. Then I was sent into the tube. It sounded like a gigantic washing machine on an un balanced cycle in my ears which made me jump. I was told to be still. The different noises was irritating my leg and made it go into spasms. The 10 minute x-ray turned out to be 20 minutes and then he tells me it doesn't look like it's going to be a clear x-ray, I may be sent back in. This would not work for me. If I was better prepped from both places my doctors and this facility I would not had to do it again! They are lucky, I passed.

originalText.text: My cousin had a 10:00 appointment. We got there at 9:45 and they were closed. The doctor that opened up came after 10:00. That is un-ex-ceptable. Even the worker were standing outside waiting. It's 80 degrees outside, we standing in the blazing sun, there was an elderly woman out there in a wheelchair waiting in 80 degree weather in the blazing sun. That is really not acceptable. That lady should not have been made to wait in that heat. If the clinic opens at 10:00 then they should be there at 9:30 to let people in. My cousin can not see the doctor for her 10:00 appointment if the clinic is not open.
